movement.note: Base movement in feet, +5 per Speed

senses.note: Base range in feet, +10 per Awareness

lifting.note: Base capacity in lbs, +50 per Strength

heroicPaths.name: Agent
heroicPaths.description: Artists of duplicity and sabotage, Agents grasp the threads of fate in the palms of their hands

keyTalent.name: Opportunist
keyTalent.description: Once per round, when you roll a plot die, you can reroll that result. The original roll has no effect and you must use the new result.

specialties.name: Investigator
specialties.description: Cultivate trustworthy instincts, learning to listen, collaborate, and pursue answers to questions others don't think to ask

talents.name: Watchful Eye
talents.description: Use Opportunist on the plot die of a willing ally within 20 feet.

talents.name: Get 'Em Talking
talents.description: Spend 1 focus to test Deduction vs. Spiritual to learn the target's motivation. During this scene, you can raise the stakes on tests to leverage this motivation.

talents.name: Quick Analysis
talents.description: Spend 2 focus to gain momentum for cognitive tests with Use a Skill, Gain Advantage, or an Agent talent.

talents.name: Baleful
talents.description: To resist your influence, a character must spend additional focus equal to your tier.

talents.name: Gather Evidence
talents.description: Gain Legal Codes expertise. When you succeed on a cognitive test against a target, you become Focused until the end of your next turn.

talents.name: Hardy
talents.description: Gain +1 max health per level (including previous levels).

talents.name: Sleuth's Instincts
talents.description: Gain an advantage on cognitive tests against characters whose motivation you know. You know when those characters lie to you.

talents.name: Close the Case
talents.description: Spend 3 focus to test Deduction vs. Cognitive, gaining an advantage if you know the target's motivation. On failure, the target gains an advantage against you. On success, they back down.

specialties.name: Spy
specialties.description: Plant themselves in sticky situations, ready to deflect or ease suspicion when it inevitably sweeps their way

talents.name: Sure Outcome
talents.description: When you use Opportunist, spend 2 focus to change opportunity to 4, or change any result to opportunity.

talents.name: Plausible Excuse
talents.description: Gain Sleight of Hand expertise. When discovered skulking, spend 2 focus to feign innocence.

talents.name: Collected
talents.description: Increase your Cognitive and Spiritual defenses by 2.

talents.name: Cover Story
talents.description: Gain a false identity and a relevant cultural expertise.

talents.name: Subtle Takedown
talents.description: Make an unarmed attack with Insight vs. an unsuspecting target's Cognitive, raising the stakes. On a hit, they can't communicate.

talents.name: Mighty
talents.description: When you hit with a weapon or unarmed attack, for each action spent, deal extra damage equal to 1 + your tier.

talents.name: Mercurial Facade
talents.description: Disguise yourself using Deception without needing physical supplies. The first character to see through your disguise is Surprised.

talents.name: High Society Contacts
talents.description: Gain High Society expertise. Spend 2 focus to add opportunity to a test to interact in high society.

specialties.name: Thief
specialties.description: Train their bodies to keep pace with their quick minds, risking it all to swindle insurmountable odds

talents.name: Risky Behavior
talents.description: Spend 1 focus to raise the stakes on your test.

talents.name: Cheap Shot
talents.description: Spend 1 focus to make an unarmed attack with Thievery vs. Cognitive, raising the stakes. On a hit, the target is Stunned.

talents.name: Double Down
talents.description: You can reroll again with Opportunist, but on complication, you lose 2 focus.

talents.name: Surefooted
talents.description: Your movement increases by 10. Reduce damage from falling and dangerous terrain by twice your tier.

talents.name: Underworld Contacts
talents.prerequisite: Patron or follower in criminal underworld
talents.description: Gain Criminal Groups expertise. Spend 2 focus to add opportunity to a social test against criminals.

talents.name: Shadow Step
talents.description: After you Disengage, spend 2 focus to test Thievery vs. each enemy's Cognitive to hide from them. You gain an advantage if in cover or obscured.

talents.name: Fast Talker
talents.description: Spend 2 focus to gain momentum for spiritual tests with Use a Skill, Gain Advantage, or an Agent talent.

talents.name: Trickster's Hand
talents.description: Spend 2 focus to gain momentum for physical tests with Use a Skill, Gain Advantage, or an Agent talent.

heroicPaths.name: Envoy
heroicPaths.description: Prominent organizations appoint Envoys who vie for resources, curry favor, or offer service on the organization's behalf

keyTalent.name: Rousing Presence
keyTalent.description: Choose an ally you can influence. They become Determined until they benefit from that condition or until the scene ends.

specialties.name: Diplomat
specialties.description: Adept at navigating court politics, using what they learn to seek favorable treatment

talents.name: Steadfast Challenge
talents.description: Spend 1 focus to test Discipline vs. an enemy's Spiritual. On success, they are Disoriented and gain a disadvantage on tests against you.

talents.name: Collected
talents.description: Increase your Cognitive and Spiritual defenses by 2.

talents.name: Withering Retort
talents.description: Use your Steadfast Challenge before an attack and increase your deflect against the attack by your ranks in Discipline.

talents.name: Well Dressed
talents.description: Gain Fashion expertise. While wearing Presentable armor or fashionable clothing, gain an advantage on your first Deception, Leadership, or Persuasion test.

talents.name: Calm Appeal
talents.description: When your Steadfast Challenge makes a target Disoriented, spend 1 focus to pacify them. Resisting your Steadfast Challenge costs additional focus equal to your ranks in Discipline.

talents.name: High Society Contacts
talents.prerequisite: Patron in high society, Well Dressed
talents.description: Gain High Society expertise. Spend 2 focus to add opportunity to a test to interact in high society.

talents.name: Peaceful Solution
talents.description: If all non-minion enemies are pacified, you ease tensions and end combat.

talents.name: Practiced Oratory
talents.description: When you use Rousing Presence or Steadfast Challenge, spend focus up to your ranks in Persuasion to add that many targets.

specialties.name: Faithful
specialties.description: Devote themselves to traditions of their faith, demonstrating convictions through word or deed

talents.name: Customary Garb
talents.description: While wearing Presentable armor or appropriate clothing, increase your Physical and Spiritual defenses by 2.

talents.name: Galvanize
talents.description: An ally rolls their recovery die and recovers that much focus.

talents.name: Devoted Presence
talents.description: When you use Rousing Presence, spend 1 focus to remove Prone, Slowed, Stunned, and Surprised from your target.

talents.name: Composed
talents.description: Increase your max and current focus by your tier.

talents.name: Stalwart Presence
talents.description: When you use Rousing Presence, spend 1 focus to increase one of the target's defenses by 2.

talents.name: Applied Motivation
talents.description: When you cause a character to recover focus, they recover additional focus equal to half your ranks in Lore.

talents.name: Sage Counsel
talents.description: When you Aid a character, spend 1 focus to grant them Rousing Presence.

talents.name: Inspired Zeal
talents.description: When an ally uses Determined, choose other allies to recover 1 focus, up to your ranks in Discipline.

specialties.name: Mentor
specialties.description: Devote themselves to their wards, patiently nurturing others toward greatness

talents.name: Sound Advice
talents.description: Spend 1 focus to use Rousing Presence on an ally who failed a skill test.

talents.name: Practical Demonstration
talents.description: When you Gain Advantage or hit with an attack, use your Rousing Presence as a free action.

talents.name: Lessons in Patience
talents.description: Gain Motivational Speech expertise. When you use Rousing Presence, your target recovers 1 focus.

talents.name: Mighty
talents.description: When you hit with a weapon or unarmed attack, for each action spent, deal extra damage equal to 1 + your tier.

talents.name: Instill Confidence
talents.description: Rousing Presence can make an ally Focused instead of Determined.

talents.name: Guiding Oration
talents.description: After you Gain Advantage, an ally within 10 feet of your target gains an advantage on their next test against your target.

talents.name: Foresight
talents.description: Gain an additional action each turn.

talents.name: Rallying Shout
talents.description: Rousing Presence can revive an Unconscious ally, and if they have 0 health, they recover health equal to their recovery die + your ranks in Leadership.

heroicPaths.name: Hunter
heroicPaths.description: The thrill of the chase thrums in a Hunter's mind as they patiently surveil

keyTalent.name: Seek Quarry
keyTalent.description: After spending 1 minute mentally preparing, you choose a character who you can sense or who you've previously encountered. That character becomes your quarry. You gain an advantage on tests made to find, attack, or study your quarry.

specialties.name: Archer
specialties.description: Shape the battlefield before frontline confrontation, steadily unleashing a torrent of arrows

talents.name: Tagging Shot
talents.description: Move 5 feet and make a ranged attack. On a hit or a graze, the target becomes your quarry.

talents.name: Combat Training
talents.description: Gain expertise in a weapon, an armor, and Military Life. Once per round, graze without spending focus.

talents.name: Sharp Eye
talents.description: Observe a target then test Perception vs. Cognitive to learn their lowest attribute, lowest defense, or if their health, focus, or Investiture are below half.

talents.name: Steady Aim
talents.description: Increase your weapon range by half and deal extra damage equal to your ranks in Perception.

talents.name: Exploit Weakness
talents.description: Gain Advantage on your quarry without spending actions.

talents.name: Backstep
talents.description: After making a ranged attack, spend 2 focus to Disengage without spending actions, and Brace if you enter cover or obscured area.

talents.name: Unrelenting Salvo
talents.description: You can Strike your quarry more than once per turn with the same ranged weapon.

talents.name: Hardy
talents.description: Gain +1 max health per level (including previous levels).

specialties.name: Assassin
specialties.description: Exploit weaknesses to quickly incapacitate their quarry

talents.name: Startling Blow
talents.description: Make an unarmed or improvised weapon attack vs. Cognitive. On a hit or graze, the target is Surprised.

talents.name: Killing Edge
talents.description: Gain Knives and Slings expertises. These weapons gain the Deadly and Quickdraw expert traits.

talents.name: Fatal Thrust
talents.description: Attack an unsuspecting target with a light melee weapon vs. Cognitive. Add 4d4 damage, and gain two advantages if the weapon is Discreet. Max damage rolls add a penalty to the injury roll.

talents.name: Shadowing
talents.description: Your quarry gains a disadvantage to sense you, and you gain an advantage to avoid their notice. When you succeed vs. Spiritual while in cover or obscured, spend 3 focus to designate that target as your quarry.

talents.name: Mighty
talents.description: When you hit with a weapon or unarmed attack, for each action spent, deal extra damage equal to 1 + your tier.

talents.name: Cold Eyes
talents.description: After you defeat your quarry, recover 1 focus and choose a new quarry.

talents.name: Swift Strikes
talents.description: Spend 1 focus to make a second Strike with the same weapon.

talents.name: Sidestep
talents.description: Gain an additional action to Dodge when you're not wearing armor with deflect of 2 or higher.

specialties.name: Tracker
specialties.description: In untamed wilds, none are more capable, with trusty animal companions at their sides

talents.name: Deadly Trap
talents.description: Conceal a 5-foot entangling or impaling trap. Entangling Trap: Test Survival vs. Cognitive, roll 2d4 impact damage, target is Immobilized. Impaling Trap: Test Survival vs. Physical, roll 2d4 keen damage, target is Afflicted.

talents.name: Animal Bond
talents.description: While your companion is within 10 feet, your defenses increase by 1. Use free action to give your companion momentum or actions on your turn. They can use Track as free action to make a target your quarry.

talents.name: Experienced Trapper
talents.description: You easily forage for characters up to your ranks in Survival. You can fashion natural tools using Survival. Your Deadly Traps increase to 2d6 damage and 2 rounds duration.

talents.name: Protective Bond
talents.description: Your animal companion protects an ally within 30 feet of you, and that ally gains your Animal Bond bonus instead of you.

talents.name: Hunter's Edge
talents.description: Your animal companion gains an advantage against your quarry. Your Deadly Traps increase to 2d8 damage and 3 rounds duration.

talents.name: Pack Hunting
talents.description: Spend 1 focus to add your ranks in Survival to your ally's attack or damage roll against your quarry.

talents.name: Surefooted
talents.description: Your movement increases by 10. Reduce damage from falling and dangerous terrain by twice your tier.

talents.name: Feral Connection
talents.description: Gain expertise in Animal Care. Your animal companion's health increases by 5 Ã— your tier, their defenses increase by 2, and their tests gain a bonus equal to your ranks in Survival.

heroicPaths.name: Leader
heroicPaths.description: Beacons of encouragement and direction, Leaders oversee the efforts of others

keyTalent.name: Decisive Command
keyTalent.description: Gain a command die (d4). Spend 1 focus to choose an ally you can influence within 20 feet. The next time they make a test before the end of their next turn, they can roll your command die and add it to one die roll from that test (other than the plot die).

specialties.name: Champion
specialties.description: Inspiring others through unfaltering grit, ferociously charging their foes

talents.name: Combat Coordination
talents.description: After you Strike, use Decisive Command as free action. If your Strike didn't hit, you also don't spend focus.

talents.name: Valiant Intervention
talents.description: Spend 1 focus to move 10 feet, then test Athletics vs. Spiritual to give a target a disadvantage on tests against your allies.

talents.name: Imposing Posture
talents.description: After an enemy resists your influence while in your weapon's reach, they are Disoriented until the end of their next turn.

talents.name: Hardy
talents.description: Gain +1 max health per level (including previous levels).

talents.name: Mighty
talents.description: When you hit with a weapon or unarmed attack, for each action spent, deal extra damage equal to 1 + your tier.

talents.name: Resolute Stand
talents.description: Valiant Intervention prevents Reactive Strikes. Spend focus up to your ranks in Leadership to add that many targets for Valiant Intervention.

talents.name: Resilient Hero
talents.description: Once per scene, before your health drops to 0, it instead becomes equal to your Athletics modifier.

talents.name: Demonstrative Command
talents.description: Increase the size of your command die. Spend 1 focus to add your command die to your Athletics, Agility, or Leadership d20 roll.

specialties.name: Officer
specialties.description: Coolly maintain order in utter chaos, orchestrating the march to victory

talents.name: Composed
talents.description: Increase your max and current focus by your tier.

talents.name: Through the Fray
talents.description: An ally within 20 feet can Disengage or Gain Advantage as free action.

talents.name: Well Supplied
talents.description: Gain Military Logistics expertise. Spend 2 focus to add opportunity to your test to requisition resources.

talents.name: Customary Garb
talents.description: While wearing Presentable armor or appropriate clothing, increase your Physical and Spiritual defenses by 2.

talents.name: Relentless March
talents.description: Decisive Command increases your target's movement by 10 feet, and they ignore Exhausted, Slowed, and Surprised.

talents.name: Confident Command
talents.description: Increase the size of your command die. Spend 1 focus to add your command die to your Intimidation, Leadership, or Persuasion d20 roll.

talents.name: Synchronized Assault
talents.description: Spend 2 focus to test Leadership vs. enemy's Cognitive. On success, allies up to your ranks in Leadership gain momentum for an additional Strike against the target. On failure, only one ally gains momentum.

talents.name: Authority
talents.prerequisite: Title granting you command of 5+ people
talents.description: Double the range of Leader talents that affect allies, and double the number of allies affected.

specialties.name: Politico
specialties.description: With a penchant for theatrics, chase favor and prestige while subtly undermining enemies

talents.name: Cutthroat Tactics
talents.description: Your ally can raise the stakes instead of rolling your command die; if they roll complication, you recover 1 focus.

talents.name: Tactical Ploy
talents.description: Test Deception vs. Cognitive to make your target lose one action and gain a disadvantage on their next cognitive or spiritual test.

talents.name: Rumormonger
talents.description: Gain Scandal expertise. Spend 2 focus to add opportunity when you make a test to spread misinformation or gather rumors.

talents.name: Well Dressed
talents.description: Gain Fashion expertise. While wearing Presentable armor or fashionable clothing, gain an advantage on your first Deception, Leadership, or Persuasion test.

talents.name: Baleful
talents.description: To resist your influence, a character must spend additional focus equal to your tier.

talents.name: Set at Odds
talents.description: Spend focus equal to the number of targets you want to seed division among. Test Leadership vs. their highest Spiritual to make them hostile to each other.

talents.name: Shrewd Command
talents.description: Increase the size of your command die. Spend 1 focus to add your command die to your Deception, Insight, or Leadership d20 roll.

talents.name: Grand Deception
talents.description: Spend 3 focus to test Deception (DC 15) to reveal a ruse that changes a detail.

heroicPaths.name: Scholar
heroicPaths.description: Creativity, acumen, and patience are hallmarks of legendary Scholars

keyTalent.name: Erudition
keyTalent.description: Choose one cultural or utility expertise you don't already have, and choose two different cognitive skills that aren't surge skills. When you make a test, you count as having the chosen expertise and one additional rank of each chosen skill. After a long rest with library access, you can reassign these.

specialties.name: Artifabrian
specialties.description: Combining science, engineering, and artistry, construct fabrials that perform precise functions

talents.name: Efficient Engineer
talents.description: Gain expertise in Armor Crafting, Equipment Crafting, or Weapon Crafting, and gain a fabrial. When crafting, your Opportunity range expands by 2 and your material cost is halved.

talents.name: Prized Acquisition
talents.description: Gain Fabrial Crafting expertise. Gain a special gem you can immediately use to craft a fabrial of your tier. You can reuse this gem for new fabrials.

talents.name: Deep Study
talents.description: Erudition grants you an additional cultural or utility expertise and two additional non-surge cognitive skills.

talents.name: Inventive Design
talents.description: Your Prized Acquisition fabrial can have an effect 1 tier higher than the tier you're currently crafting.

talents.name: Fine Handiwork
talents.description: When crafting, advanced features cost one upgrade instead of two.

talents.name: Overcharge
talents.description: Once per turn, you can raise the stakes on a fabrial attack, then spend opportunity to Strike with that fabrial as free action.

talents.name: Experimental Tinkering
talents.description: When crafting, your Opportunity range expands by 1 and your crafting time is halved. During a long rest, you can reconfigure your Prized Acquisition fabrial to a different fabrial.

talents.name: Overwhelm with Details
talents.description: Spend 2 focus to use your Lore modifier on another cognitive or spiritual test.

specialties.name: Strategist
specialties.description: Always three steps ahead, knowing timing is everything

talents.name: Strategize
talents.description: Test Deduction vs. Cognitive to learn one of target's defenses, health, focus, or Investiture. On opportunity, learn all.

talents.name: Mind and Body
talents.description: Choose a physical skill. When you make a test with that skill, you can use your Intellect modifier instead of the usual attribute.

talents.name: Know Your Moment
talents.description: Gain +2 to initiative. When you succeed on Strategize, your target gains a disadvantage on their next test.

talents.name: Deep Contemplation
talents.description: Spend 2 focus and 1 minute to remove Confused and Disoriented from you and allies within 10 feet, and they gain momentum for their next cognitive test.

talents.name: Turning Point
talents.description: After an ally within 20 feet fails a test, spend 3 focus to let them reroll, adding your Intellect modifier to one die.

talents.name: Read the Field
talents.description: Spend 2 focus to test Lore vs. Cognitive of all enemies within 30 feet. Those who fail are Surprised and grant advantage to your allies.

specialties.name: Surgeon
specialties.description: Apply their knowledge and empathy to heal the unwell and save lives

talents.name: Field Medicine
talents.description: Test Medicine (DC 10) to let an ally roll their recovery die and recover that much health. On opportunity, they also recover focus equal to your Intellect modifier.

talents.name: Emotional Intelligence
talents.description: Choose Insight or Persuasion. When you make a test with that skill, you can use your Intellect modifier instead of the usual attribute.

talents.name: Ongoing Care
talents.description: When you use Field Medicine, spend 1 focus to also remove one condition or reduce injury level by 1.

talents.name: Medical Expertise
talents.description: Gain three medical utility expertises. Your Medicine tests to treat injuries, diseases, or poisons expand Opportunity range by 2.

talents.name: Resuscitate
talents.description: Spend 3 focus to revive an Unconscious ally. They recover health equal to their recovery die + your Intellect modifier.

talents.name: Miraculous Recovery
talents.description: When you treat someone during a long rest, they recover an additional recovery die of health and remove one injury level.

heroicPaths.name: Warrior
heroicPaths.description: Roshar is a world riven by conflict, and many of its people follow the path of the Warrior

keyTalent.name: Vigilant Stance
keyTalent.description: You learn to use stances. Enter Vigilant Stance: While in this stance, reduce the focus cost of your Dodge and Reactive Strike reactions by 1. Additionally, you can enter another stance you know as free action.

specialties.name: Duelist
specialties.description: In the inner circles of the elite, contend for glory and political sway

talents.name: Practiced Kata
talents.description: You can now use stances in conversations and endeavors, and unless Surprised, you can start each scene in Vigilant Stance. Spend 1 focus to enter a stance mid-conversation or mid-endeavor.

talents.name: Flamestance
talents.description: Enter Flamestance: You gain an advantage on Intimidation, and when only one enemy is in reach and no allies are, gain momentum to attack or Gain Advantage.

talents.name: Ironstance
talents.description: Enter Ironstance: You gain an advantage on Insight, and when you're grazed or missed, you can make a Reactive Strike against your attacker.

talents.name: Signature Weapon
talents.description: Gain a weapon expertise. Choose one of your weapon expertises, expanding its Opportunity range by 1 (2 at tier 3).

talents.name: Surefooted
talents.description: Your movement increases by 10. Reduce damage from falling and dangerous terrain by twice your tier.

talents.name: Feinting Strike
talents.description: Spend 2 focus to make a melee weapon attack vs. Cognitive. On a hit, your target loses one action and loses focus equal to your ranks in Intimidation. On a graze, they lose half as much focus.

talents.name: Vinestance
talents.description: Enter Vinestance: Your Physical and Cognitive defenses increase by 1. After you're hit or grazed in melee, spend momentum to test Athletics vs. Cognitive to make attacker lose 1d4 focus and be pushed.

talents.name: Wit's End
talents.description: Spend 1 focus to move half your movement then make a melee weapon attack vs. Cognitive of a target who has 0 focus. This attack ignores deflect, deals an extra 4d6 damage, and can't graze.

specialties.name: Shardbearer
specialties.description: Wield Shardblades and Shardplate to dominate the battlefield with mythic might

talents.name: Shard Training
talents.prerequisite: Access to a Shardblade and Shardplate
talents.description: Gain Shardplate expertise, and gain either Grandbow, Shardblade, or Warhammer expertise. Your Shardplate has 2 additional charges. Your Shardblade Strikes graze additional targets up to your ranks in the skill used.

talents.name: Stonestance
talents.description: Enter Stonestance: Your deflect increases by 1, and enemies within your reach must spend an additional action to attack your allies who aren't in Stonestance.

talents.name: Windstance
talents.description: Enter Windstance: Gain an advantage on Agility. While you can reach multiple enemies, use free action to gain momentum to Disengage or attack.

talents.name: Mighty
talents.description: When you hit with a weapon or unarmed attack, for each action spent, deal extra damage equal to 1 + your tier.

talents.name: Shattering Blow
talents.description: When you hit with a melee attack, spend 2 focus to deplete 1 charge from their armor, and each target you damage is pushed 5 feet.

talents.name: Bloodstance
talents.description: Enter Bloodstance: Your Opportunity range for attacks and physical tests expands by 2, but your Physical, Cognitive, and Spiritual defenses decrease by 2.

talents.name: Precise Parry
talents.description: Before being hit in melee, spend 1 focus to attempt to turn it into a graze. Test Athletics (unarmed) or Light/Heavy Weaponry (armed) vs. triggering attack.

talents.name: Meteoric Leap
talents.description: Spend 2 focus to leap a quarter of your movement and make unarmed attack vs. Physical of multiple targets, doubling damage and knocking weaker targets Prone. Gain an advantage in Shardplate.

specialties.name: Soldier
specialties.description: The most common of fighting forces, mastering tactics to fight effectively in units

talents.name: Cautious Advance
talents.description: Move up to half your movement, ignoring difficult terrain, then gain momentum to Brace or Gain Advantage.

talents.name: Combat Training
talents.description: Gain expertise in a weapon, armor, and Military Life. Once per round, graze without spending focus.

talents.name: Defensive Position
talents.description: The Brace action adds two disadvantages to attacks against you, instead of one, and allies can Brace behind your shield.

talents.name: Devastating Blow
talents.description: Make a melee weapon attack vs. Physical, rolling an extra 2d8 damage.

talents.name: Formation Drills
talents.description: Allies within 10 feet who Brace gain the benefits of your Defensive Position.

talents.name: Hardy
talents.description: Gain +1 max health per level (including previous levels).

talents.name: Wary
talents.description: You can't be Surprised while you have focus. When you lose focus involuntarily, reduce the amount lost by your ranks in Discipline.

talents.name: Swift Strikes
talents.description: Spend 1 focus to make a second Strike with the same weapon.

radiantOrders.name: Windrunners
radiantOrders.description: Protect those who cannot protect themselves
oaths: I will protect those who cannot protect themselves
I will protect even those I hate, even if the one I hate most is myself

keyTalent.name: First Ideal (Windrunner Key)
keyTalent.description: Begin bonding an honorspren and gain Investiture

specialties.name: Honorspren Bond
specialties.description: Talents unique to your bond with an honorspren companion

talents.name: First Ideal (Windrunner Key)
talents.description: Gain Investiture score and the Breathe Stormlight, Enhance, and Regenerate actions. When you complete the goal 'Speak the First Ideal,' you become Empowered and gain access to Adhesion and Gravitation surges.

talents.name: Second Ideal
talents.description: Gain the goal 'Speak the Second Ideal.' After completing it, you become Empowered and can use Enhance as a free action without spending Investiture.

talents.name: Third Ideal
talents.description: Gain the goal 'Speak the Third Ideal.' After completing it, you become Empowered and can summon your spren as a Radiant Shardblade.

talents.name: Fourth Ideal
talents.description: Gain the goal 'Speak the Fourth Ideal.' After completing it, you become Empowered and can call a swarm of windspren as Radiant Shardplate.

talents.name: Reverse Lashing
talents.description: Infuse yourself or an object with a mix of Adhesion and Gravitation, giving it a weak gravitational pull on specific objects within your gravitation rate distance.

talents.name: Invested
talents.description: Your maximum Investiture increases by a number equal to your tier. When your tier increases by 1, your maximum Investiture does as well.

talents.name: Wound Regeneration
talents.description: When you use Regenerate, you can spend 2 Investiture to recover from a temporary injury, or spend 3 Investiture to recover from a permanent one.

talents.name: Deepened Bond
talents.description: Your spren bond range increases from 30 feet to 100 feet. Additionally, when you spend focus to give your spren a task, it costs you 1 fewer focus (to a minimum cost of 1).

talents.name: Take Squire
talents.description: After a long rest, choose willing companions to take as your squires, granting them your surges and the ability to Breathe Stormlight, Enhance, and Regenerate. You can have a maximum number of squires up to twice your level.

radiantOrders.name: Skybreakers
radiantOrders.description: Enforce the law and strive for justice

keyTalent.name: First Ideal (Skybreaker Key)
keyTalent.description: Begin bonding a highspren and gain Investiture

specialties.name: Highspren Bond
specialties.description: Talents unique to your bond with a highspren companion

talents.name: First Ideal (Skybreaker Key)
talents.description: Gain Investiture score and the Breathe Stormlight, Enhance, and Regenerate actions. When you complete the goal 'Speak the First Ideal,' you become Empowered and gain access to Division and Gravitation surges.

talents.name: Second Ideal

talents.name: Third Ideal

talents.name: Fourth Ideal

talents.name: Soaring Destruction

talents.name: Invested
talents.description: Your maximum Investiture increases by a number equal to your tier. When your tier increases by 1, your maximum Investiture does as well.

talents.name: Wound Regeneration
talents.description: When you use Regenerate, you can spend 2 Investiture to recover from a temporary injury, or spend 3 Investiture to recover from a permanent one.

talents.name: Deepened Bond
talents.description: Your spren bond range increases from 30 feet to 100 feet. Additionally, when you spend focus to give your spren a task, it costs you 1 fewer focus (to a minimum cost of 1).

talents.name: Take Squire
talents.description: After a long rest, choose willing companions to take as your squires, granting them your surges and the ability to Breathe Stormlight, Enhance, and Regenerate. You can have a maximum number of squires equal to your current Ideal.

conditions.name: Blinded
conditions.description: Cannot see. Attacks against you gain advantage, your attacks gain disadvantage.

conditions.name: Deafened
conditions.description: Cannot hear. Disadvantage on Perception tests that rely on hearing.

conditions.name: Frightened
conditions.description: Disadvantage on attacks and tests while source of fear is in line of sight.

conditions.name: Immobilized
conditions.description: Speed becomes 0. Cannot Move or use movement.

conditions.name: Prone
conditions.description: Melee attacks against you gain advantage. Ranged attacks gain disadvantage. Moving requires half movement to stand.

conditions.name: Restrained
conditions.description: Speed becomes 0. Attacks gain disadvantage. Attacks against you gain advantage.

conditions.name: Stunned
conditions.description: Cannot take actions or reactions. Attacks against you gain advantage.

conditions.name: Unconscious
conditions.description: Cannot take actions. Drop items. Attacks against you gain advantage and auto-crit within 5 feet.

abrasion.name: Abrasion
abrasion.description: Alters the frictional force on an object's surface
abrasion.baseAbility: Spend 1 Investiture or more to infuse an object or surface, making it frictionless. Alternatively, infuse yourself to use Skate (move fast in straight line) and Slide (squeeze through spaces easier).

talents.name: Frictionless Motion
talents.description: While infused with Abrasion, your movement rate increases by 10 feet, and you ignore the Slowed condition when imposed by difficult terrain, climbing, crawling, and swimming.

talents.name: Reverse Abrasion
talents.description: You can increase friction instead of reducing it. Infused targets give an advantage on Agility and Athletics tests and ignore Slowed conditions from surfaces.

talents.name: Graceful Skating
talents.description: When you Skate, you aren't restricted to moving in a straight line.

talents.name: Stormlight Reclamation
talents.description: At the start of your turn, you can end any number of infusions within your reach to regain their remaining Investiture.

talents.name: Slippery Target
talents.description: While infused with Abrasion, attacks can't graze you and Reactive Strikes against you gain a disadvantage.

talents.name: Distant Surgebinding
talents.description: You can use your surges and their talents as though your reach is 20 feet, and you don't need to touch the target.

talents.name: Slick Combatant
talents.description: While infused with Abrasion, you can interrupt a Move with other actions. Once per round, deal extra damage (scaling with Abrasion ranks) on a mid-movement attack.

talents.name: Smooth Operator
talents.description: While you have Investiture, you are infused with Abrasion without spending Investiture, and it costs you 1 fewer focus to Skate.

adhesion.name: Adhesion
adhesion.description: Binds things together through Full Lashing
adhesion.baseAbility: Spend 1 Investiture to perform a Full Lashing, sticking two objects or an object to a surface together. The objects must be within reach and 5 feet of each other.

talents.name: Binding Strike
talents.description: After hitting with a melee attack, spend 2 focus or an Opportunity to use Adhesion without spending an action. Automatically succeed on the test.

talents.name: Stormlight Reclamation
talents.description: At the start of your turn, you can end any number of infusions within your reach to regain their remaining Investiture.

talents.name: Binding Shot
talents.description: You can use Binding Strike when you hit with a ranged attack at any distance.

talents.name: Adhesive Trap
talents.description: Infuse a surface with Adhesion. Characters who touch it become Fully Lashed to it automatically.

talents.name: Distant Surgebinding
talents.description: Use your surges and their talents as though your reach is 20 feet, and you don't need to touch the target.

talents.name: Extended Adhesion
talents.description: Full Lashings expend 1 Investiture per number of rounds equal to your ranks in Adhesion (e.g., 3 ranks = every 3 rounds).

talents.name: Superior Bond
talents.description: Automatically succeed on opposed tests to maintain Full Lashings against characters with Strength no higher than your ranks in Adhesion.

talents.name: Living Adhesion
talents.description: You can use Adhesion on characters. When Lashed to something larger, they become Restrained, gain disadvantage on physical tests, and attacks against them gain advantage.

cohesion.name: Cohesion
cohesion.description: Mold stone as if it were clay (Stoneshaping)
cohesion.baseAbility: Spend 1 Investiture to infuse stone within reach, making it moldable and soft like clay. You can reshape it immediately or with additional actions for intricate work.

talents.name: Stone Spear
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture to make a ranged Cohesion attack vs. Physical of a target within 60 feet, rolling 2d4 impact damage (scales with ranks).

talents.name: Memories of Stone
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture to communicate with stone you're touching, gaining visions of its history and memories.

talents.name: Sinkhole
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture to test Cohesion vs. Cognitive of targets on stone ground. On success, they sink and become Immobilized.

talents.name: Tunneling
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture to move through stone as if through difficult terrain, leaving a 5-foot tunnel behind you.

talents.name: Through the Stone
talents.description: Use your surges and their talents as though your reach is 20 feet, as long as there's a stone surface between you and your target.

talents.name: True Stoneshaping
talents.description: Intricately and extensively shape stone without using additional actions or time.

talents.name: Flowing Earth
talents.description: After using Cohesion, shape the stone beneath your feet, pushing yourself in any direction up to 5 feet Ã— your ranks in Cohesion.

talents.name: Unbound Cohesion
talents.description: Use Cohesion on any solid material that isn't alive, Invested, or infused with Stormlight.

division.name: Division
division.description: Destroy and decay targets, causing them to crumble or burn
division.baseAbility: Target a character (melee Division attack vs. Spiritual for 3d4 spirit damage, scales with ranks), or destroy an object/area (spend 1+ Investiture to destroy/decay materials).

talents.name: Bodily Decay
talents.description: When you hit with a Division attack, you can spend an Opportunity to cause one target to suffer an injury.

talents.name: Eroding Escape
talents.description: Spend 1 or more Investiture to end that many effects inflicting the Restrained or Immobilized condition.

talents.name: Igniting Division
talents.description: When you use Division, spend 1 or more Investiture to light the target's space on fire, dealing ongoing damage equal to your Division modifier.

talents.name: Spark Sending
talents.description: When there's a solid surface between you and target, use Division as though your reach is 20 feet.

talents.name: Gout of Flame
talents.description: Spend 3 Investiture to make a Division attack vs. Physical against each target in an area one size larger than normal.

talents.name: Inescapable Spark
talents.description: Spark Sending extends to your spren bond range. You don't need line of effect when you can sense your target, and they can't Brace against your Division.

talents.name: Devastating Division
talents.description: When you roll damage for Division or its talents, roll an additional damage die of the same size.

gravitation.name: Gravitation
gravitation.description: Manipulate gravity through Basic and Reverse Lashings
gravitation.baseAbility: Spend 1 Investiture to perform a Basic Lashing (change gravity direction for yourself or target) or Reverse Lashing (make yourself a source of gravity, pulling nearby objects).

talents.name: Flying Ace
talents.description: Fly up to your gravitation rate (permanently increases to 40 feet). Spend 1 focus to make a melee weapon attack during this flight.

talents.name: Gravitational Slam
talents.description: Use a Basic Lashing to collide a target with a solid surface, dealing 1d4 impact damage per 10 feet moved (scales with ranks). Target can Avoid Danger to halve damage.

talents.name: Stable Flight
talents.description: While maintaining a Basic Lashing on yourself, your ranged attacks don't gain disadvantage due to flying or unstable footing.

talents.name: Multiple Lashings
talents.description: When you move an unwilling character with Gravitation, infuse Investiture up to your ranks in Gravitation to prolong the effect.

talents.name: Group Flight
talents.description: When you use a Basic Lashing out of combat, infuse additional characters up to your ranks in Gravitation without spending additional Investiture.

talents.name: Lashing Shot
talents.description: Propel an object at a target, making a ranged Gravitation attack vs. Physical, rolling 2d4 impact damage (scales with ranks).

talents.name: Master of the Skies
talents.description: While you have 1 Investiture or more, you gain the benefits of being infused with Gravitation without spending Investiture.

illumination.name: Illumination
illumination.description: Create convincing visual and auditory illusions (Lightweaving)
illumination.baseAbility: Spend 1 Investiture to Lightweave an illusion in a space within spren bond range (simple: 1 per 10 min, complex: 1 per round). Can also create an illusory disguise on yourself while having Investiture.

talents.name: Distracting Illusion
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture to Lightweave an illusion of yourself or an ally. Until an attack misses the target, attacks against them gain disadvantage and can't graze.

talents.name: Lingering Lightweavings
talents.description: You can infuse an illusion in a sphere. The illusion moves with the sphere, expending 1 Investiture per rounds equal to your ranks in Illumination.

talents.name: Disorienting Flash
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture to project light in an area, testing Illumination vs. Cognitive of each character to make them Disoriented.

talents.name: Stormlight Reclamation
talents.description: End Illumination infusions within spren bond range and recover their remaining Investiture.

talents.name: Spiritual Illumination
talents.description: Spend 2 Investiture to cause an ally to become Determined and Focused.

talents.name: Multiplicative Lightweaving
talents.description: You can Lightweave additional illusions, up to your ranks in Illumination, with no additional Investiture.

talents.name: Painful Truth
talents.description: Spend 2 Investiture and test Illumination vs. Spiritual of a target. On success, they are Slowed and must Move away on their next turn or spend focus to avoid doing so.

talents.name: Endless Illusions
talents.description: While you have Investiture, Illumination infusions in your spren bond range don't expend Investiture.

progression.name: Progression
progression.description: Encourage growth and healing in living things
progression.baseAbility: Spend Investiture to use Growth (rapidly grow plants) or Regrowth (heal living beings). Regenerate action: recover health equal to your Progression modifier.

talents.name: Injury Regrowth
talents.description: Spend 2 Investiture to cause a target to recover from a temporary injury, or spend 3 Investiture to recover from a permanent one.

talents.name: Explosive Growth
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture to explosively grow plants in an area. Make a Progression attack vs. Physical of each chosen character, rolling 2d4 impact or keen damage (scales with ranks).

talents.name: Swift Regeneration
talents.description: When you Regenerate, recover health equal to 1d6 + your Progression modifier (scales with ranks). While you have Investiture, you and your Regrowth targets can add your Progression modifier to injury rolls.

talents.name: Overgrowth
talents.description: When you infuse Growth into a plant, test Progression (DC 15) to cause it to grow much larger and stronger than its species' normal limits.

talents.name: Extended Regrowth
talents.description: Your Regrowth infusions only expend 1 Investiture per rounds equal to your ranks in Progression.

talents.name: Reliable Progression
talents.description: When you roll a Progression die, if the result is lower than your ranks in Progression, change the result to equal your ranks.

talents.name: From the Brink
talents.description: Spend 3 Investiture to restore life to a willing character who died within the last minute. They return Unconscious with 0 health.

talents.name: Font of Life
talents.description: It costs you one Opportunity fewer to use Progression and its talents.

tension.name: Tension
tension.description: Alter the rigidity of soft materials, making them firm like steel
tension.baseAbility: Spend 1 Investiture to infuse a soft object, making it completely rigid. Can grant Hardened Defense (+2 Physical defense) or temporarily create weapons from cloth/rope.

talents.name: Tension Parry
talents.description: Spend 2 focus to flare Tension in your clothing or a held object, causing an attack to miss.

talents.name: Stormlight Reclamation
talents.description: End Tension infusions within reach and recover their remaining Investiture.

talents.name: Rigged Weaponry
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture to increase your melee weapon's reach by 10 feet. When you hit with a melee attack, spend an Opportunity or 2 focus to infuse Tension into an object the target is holding.

talents.name: Extended Tension
talents.description: Your Tension infusions only expend 1 Investiture per rounds equal to your ranks in Tension. While you have Investiture, you can freely maintain Tension infusions on objects you're holding.

talents.name: Surface Tension
talents.description: Use Tension to increase a liquid's surface tension and walk on it like solid ground.

talents.name: Cloth Mastery
talents.description: Use Tension to instantly create intricate and complex objects.

talents.name: Fine Control
talents.description: Spend Investiture to infuse an object you can control with Opportunities while touching it. It can move up to 25 feet along surfaces, perform tasks, and make attacks using your Tension (2d4 impact damage, scales with ranks).

talents.name: Clothsmith
talents.description: Your Hardened Defense effect increases the target's Physical defense by 4 instead of 2. When you temporarily create a weapon with Tension, it gains an extra d4 damage die.

transformation.name: Transformation
transformation.description: Transform matter from one Essence to another (Soulcasting)
transformation.baseAbility: Spend Investiture to transform non-living objects between Essences (Clear Air, Liquid, Wood/Grain, Flesh/Bone, Stone). More distant transformations cost more and have higher DCs. Can also create Soulcast Defense to deflect attacks.

talents.name: Essence to Essence
talents.description: Reduce the Investiture cost of Soulcasting by 1 when transforming between Essences that are adjacent on the list.

talents.name: Living Soulcasting
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture and make a melee Transformation attack vs. Spiritual of a living organism, rolling 3d4 spirit damage (scales with ranks). The target dies if reduced to 0 health.

talents.name: Soulcast Parry
talents.description: You can use Soulcast Defense on melee weapon attacks.

talents.name: Bloodcasting
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture and test Transformation (DC 15) to cleanse all poison from the target and reduce one injury's recovery time by 5 days.

talents.name: Distant Surgebinding
talents.description: Use your surges and their talents as though your reach is 20 feet.

talents.name: Flamecasting
talents.description: You gain 'Flame' as a sixth category (DC 30 to transform stone to flame). When Soulcasting flames, attack each character within 5 feet using Transformation vs. Physical, rolling 2d4 energy damage (scales with ranks).

talents.name: Persistent Transformation
talents.description: When transforming non-living objects, your max DC is 15. You can reattempt Soulcasting, but on success, must spend 1 additional Investiture per recent failure.

talents.name: Expansive Transmuter
talents.description: Soulcasting non-living material costs 2 fewer Investiture.

transportation.name: Transportation
transportation.description: Peer into and travel through the Cognitive Realm (Shadesmar)
transportation.baseAbility: Peer into the Cognitive Realm to sense nearby flames (indicating living beings), Invested objects, and the environment. Can attempt Realmic Step to teleport short distances.

talents.name: Cognitive Farsight
talents.description: You can spot things in the Cognitive Realm up to a distance equal to 3 Ã— your spren bond range. While you have Investiture, you can identify north and the direction to the nearest settlement.

talents.name: Realmic Evasion
talents.description: Before you're hit by an attack, spend 1 Investiture and test Transportation (DC equals triggering attack). On failure, the attack grazes. On success, the attack misses.

talents.name: Cognitive Vision
talents.description: When you use Transportation to look into the Cognitive Realm, you can learn an enemy's intent by testing Transportation vs. Cognitive, and you can learn about your immediate environment.

talents.name: Realmic Step
talents.description: Test Transportation (DC 15) and spend 2 Investiture to transport yourself to a space within spren bond range.

talents.name: Shared Transportation
talents.description: When you transport yourself, spend 1 Investiture or more to bring that many additional characters with you.

talents.name: Elsecalling
talents.prerequisite: Speak the Third Ideal, Realmic Step
talents.description: Spend 1 Investiture to transport yourself from the Physical to the Cognitive Realm, or test Transportation (DC 20) and spend 2 Investiture to transport from the Cognitive to the Physical Realm.

talents.name: Elsegate
talents.prerequisite: Speak the Fourth Ideal, Shared Transportation
talents.description: Transport yourself and up to ten companions to an Oathgate or permanent perpendicularity you've visited before.

talents.name: Realmwalker
talents.description: When you test Transportation for a talent, you automatically succeed.
